intro: Senecio hieracioides, commonly known as common groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom from June to September. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and wastelands. Senecio hieracioides is an annual plant that produces numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
